item.title: Compilers Introduction
item.description: If you’ve ever found yourself intrigued by the complex science behind how exactly your written code transforms into an understandable stream of zeroes and ones, then you’re in exactly the right place. The realm of computer science goes far beyond just writing lines of code â€” at its core, it is about facilitating communication between humans and machines. This blog post pulls back the curtain on one such essential tool that makes this interaction possible: compilers.

item.title: KarolaScript
item.description: In my quest to better comprehend the fascinating intricacies of compilation process, compiler, and interpreter knowledge, I embarked on a journey of creating my own programming language - KarolaScript. KarolaScript is a decidely bare-bones, yet enlightening endeavor, which brings the underpinnings of a language interpreter to the foreground. It doesn’t boast rich features like an interactive debugger or a sophisticated static analyzer, as its primary purpose is to serve as a learning playground.
